heading: 99% of personal computers are vulnerable
subtitle: Oracle Java, Adobe Reader or Adobe Flash is present on 99% of computers. These present often extremely critical vulnerabilities.

heading: You’ve probably already been hacked
subtitle: Everyday data breaches expose an average of 6 million records, containing sensitive personal data.

heading: Cyber crime is on the up
subtitle: Year on year both the volume of attacks, and cost of recovery, is up an average of 26%. Hackers are getting increasingly more sophisticated.

reference.title: Financial Times, Cost of cyber crime

heading: Cyber crime costs us $600 billion annually
subtitle: Every year, businesses and individuals globally declare an average total of $600 billion of unrecoverable funds, due to cyber crime.

heading: Globally, cyber crime is now the 2nd most reported crime
subtitle: Yet most of us still haven’t taken the most basic of steps to protect ourselves from even the most common of threats.

heading: It often takes several months to detect an attack
subtitle: Attacks often take an average of 146 days to be found, by which time a critical amount of damage could have been done.

heading: Servers are being targeted at a near constant-rate
subtitle: Hackers are checking for common vulnerabilities to exploit on servers on average, once every 39 seconds.

reference.title: University of Maryland, rate of attempted hacks
